title: Album Page, "Campanile, St. Zeno, Verona", October 7, 1887
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick, cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Verso, stamped in black ink (smudged) and inscribed in a wreath: Museum / for the / Arts / of / Decoration.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, top right corner: (inscribed in circle) 3 / 75; to right of drawing: Campanile of St. Zeno / Verona / Oct 7th 1887.
description: Vertical sheet that has been cut down.  Depicted is a tall, slender Romanesque bell tower.  The tower has alternating rows of red and white masonry in the center.  The top of the tower is completed by two smaller towers at the corner and a steeple that is terracotta brown, to imply tilework.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Campanile, St. Zeno, Verona", October 7, 1887.
October 7, 1887. Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick, cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-2.
